title: Magnetic flux - magnetic flux through square loop

content.question: A square loop of side length <math alttext="0.03 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.03</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> is in a region of uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="3.25 T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.25</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>. The magnetic field makes an angle of <math alttext="60 degrees " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math> with a normal vector to the plane of the loop. Which of the following is most nearly equal to the magnetic flux through the loop?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.5 times 10 to the negative 3 power weber" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Wb</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the negative 3 power weber" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Wb</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.9 times 10 to the negative 3 power weber" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Wb</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4.6 times 10 to the negative 3 power weber" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Wb</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.5 times 10 to the negative 3 power weber" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Wb</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
